qas.question: Who was the first Roman Emporor that was baptized?
What did Constantine the Great and Licinius pass to introduce toleration of Christianity in the Roman Empire?
What was the high priest in the College of Pontiffs called?
What were the meetings called that were hosted by Constantine that helped enforce orthodoxy by Imperial authority?
Who was the first Roman babtized?
What Edict established freedom of religion in Rome?
Who was high priest according to Christian tradition?
What council was first held by Arius?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>Constantine the Great<b4_0/><a0_0/>, who along with Licinius had decreed toleration of <b5_0>Christianity<b5_0/> in the Roman Empire by what is commonly called the <b6_0>"<a1_0>Edict of Milan<a1_0/>"<b6_0/>, and was the first Roman Emperor baptized, set precedents for later policy. By Roman law <b7_0>the Emperor<b7_0/> was <a2_0>Pontifex Maximus<a2_0/>, the high priest of the College of Pontiffs (Collegium Pontificum) of all recognized religions in ancient Rome. To put an end to the doctrinal debate initiated by Arius, Constantine called the first of what would afterwards be called <a3_0>the <b8_0>ecumenical<b8_0/> councils<a3_0/> and then enforced orthodoxy by Imperial authority.
